Description: It is increasingly recognized that social factors have profound impacts on cancer outcomes, from treatment, survivorship care, to survival. The inequitable distribution of social and economic resources across population groups leads to disparities in these cancer outcomes. This session will review current frameworks for conceptualizing and measuring the impacts of social and socioeconomic factors at multiple levels, from societal, institutional, to interpersonal; contemporary research studying these factors in adolescent and young adult and in adult cancer patients, and solutions for intervening upon social and socioeconomic disparities
SearchResultBody: SY15. Socioeconomic Contributions to Cancer Health Disparities
Title: Socioeconomic Contributions to Cancer Health Disparities
